<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=4933) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=687" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 171 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Archetypes** [Assassin](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=48) (Level 6), [Poisoner](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=71) (Level 6), [Drow Shootist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=90) (Level 8), [Assassin](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=239) (Level 6), [Poisoner](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=259) (Level 6), [Red Mantis Assassin](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=271) (Level 6)

**Requirements**
You are wielding a weapon.

</column>

---

You apply a contact poison or injury poison to the required weapon; if you have a free hand, you can Interact to draw a poison as part of this action. This poison can be one of the simple injury poisons you can create due to this feat (see Special), or another contact or injury poison you’ve acquired (such as those in GM Core).

**Special** During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your rogue level. These follow the rules for injury poisons (GM Core, page 248), except that they deal 1d4 poison damage with no saving throw. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.

<title level="2">Poison Weapon leads to...</title>
[Improved Poison Weapon](/Feats.aspx?ID=4951)
